basic.description: Examines the formation and dynamics of global capitalism, its divisions of labour and consumption, the (re)production of global inequalities. Topics include classical and contemporary theories of uneven development; industrialisation; the creation of labour forces; global commodity chains; and the ecological contradictions of global development. Offered depending on availability of faculty. Three term-hours; Not offered 2011-2012.
basic.subject: DEVS
basic.title: Labour And Consumption
